Accessors

absoluteValue

  • get absoluteValue(): number
    • Defined in note/note.ts:67

    Represents a value for distinguish of diferents sound of notes.

    If the note are enharmonic, they have the same absolute value.

    It is used for internal functions.

    Returns number

Methods

distanceOf

  • distanceOf(note: Note): NoteDistance
    • Defined in note/note.ts:154

    Parameters

    • note: Note

    Returns NoteDistance

    the distance between the current note and the provided

    e.g:

    let g = Note.parse('G')
let a = Note.parse('A')

let distance = g.distanceOf(a)
// { notes : 1, semitones : 2 }

enharmonicToNoteAbove

  • enharmonicToNoteAbove(): Note
    • Defined in note/note.ts:85

    Find enharmonic note above

    e.g:

    let note = Note.parse('C#')
.enharmonicToNoteAbove()

note.toString() // Db

    Returns Note

    enharmonic note above or null if doesn't exists

enharmonicToNoteBelow

  • enharmonicToNoteBelow(): Note
    • Defined in note/note.ts:102

    Find enharmonic note below

    e.g:

    let note = Note.parse('Db')
.enharmonicToNoteBelow()

note.toString() // C#

    Returns Note

    enharmonic note above or null if doesn't exists

isAlterationBelow

  • isAlterationBelow(alteration: NoteAlteration): boolean
    • Defined in note/note.ts:137

    Parameters

    • alteration: NoteAlteration

      alteration to compare

    Returns boolean

    true if the current note alteration it's below the provided alteration.

    Compare the current note alteration with the provided one.

    e.g:

    let isAltBelow = Note
.parse('C#')
.isAlterationBelow(NoteAlteration.FLAT)

isAltBelow // false

toString

  • toString(notation?: Notation): string
    • Defined in note/note.ts:240

    Parameters

    • Default value notation: Notation = Notation.AMERICAN

      optional parameter. American by default.

    Returns string

    the note as String

    e.g with American:

    Note.parse('A').toString() // "A"
Note.parse('A').toString(Notation.AMERICAN) // "A"

    e.g with Southern European:

    Note.parse('A').toString(Notation.SOUTHERN_EUROPEAN) // "LA"

traspose

  • traspose(distance: NoteDistance): Note
    • Defined in note/note.ts:185

    Parameters

    • distance: NoteDistance

    Returns Note

    the trasposed note

    e.g:

    let noteA = Note.parse('A')
let distance = { notes: 1, semitones : 2 }

noteA.traspose(distance) // B

trasposeTonality

  • trasposeTonality(fromTonality: Note, toTonality: Note): Note
    • Defined in note/note.ts:211

    Parameters

    • fromTonality: Note

      The current tonality context of the note

    • toTonality: Note

      The desired tonality context for the note

    Returns Note

    the note trasposed to represent the same interval in the new tonality as was in the current.

    e.g:

    let noteA = Note.parse('A')
let currentTonality = Note.parse('C')
let newTonality = Note.parse('D')

noteA.traspose(currentTonality, newTonality) // B

    In the example, A represent a 6M in C, as B is a 6M in D.
